place_description: The Everyday Market is a community-focused cafe that strives to create simple and delicious made-from-scratch food paired with exceptional coffee.

reviews_data.review_text:
Ordered frappes and some baked goods- we watched the frappes get made and didn't see the barista add any coffee (was literally just ice, milk, and coco powder), we couldn't taste any coffee either. We asked about it and the barista said no, they don't put coffee in frappes(makes no sense). We asked for some shots of espresso so we could mix it into the frappes then, and the barista just threw all of them away and said she'd remake them.

She then went on to make 5 drinks for other customers including another barista who was sitting at a table on break before remaking ours, which was another 30 minute wait.

On top of it all, the barista was rude, not apologetic, and the drinks were like $7 each. Cute atmosphere, but that's about it. Wouldn't recommend.

You guys should consider opening a shop near harris corners on north lake parkway. There are loads of offices nearby and a very very limited options for a good lunch and breakfast with healthy options.

Ordered Frappuccino's - they had no coffee.  Asked to have them add coffee or espresso shot when couldn't taste any coffee, barista made 5 other drinks which took a literal 30 minutes before remaking ours after throwing ours away (we just asked her to put coffee or an espresso shot on top and we were fine stirring it in).

Frappuccino's come with coffee and they were $7 each.  The woman barista around 7pm on Saturday March 29 was rude when asking for coffee to be added.   Also ordered baked goods which were good but nothing crazy (and were $6 per piece of carrot cake) Will not be back and would not recommend.
Best kept secret in Loso! The caprese sandwich and chai latte are AMAZING

Had the latte with oatmilk/brown sugar syrup and then the almond crossaint. Both were very tasty (the latte especially), service was fast, and staff are very friendly! (I'd add an extra star simply because whoever was on the aux cord 10/10)
Love it here...the food is so good & the staff are so sweet. Also, a great spot to do some work :)

Coffee was bitter, not enough milk in the cappuccino. Almond croissant wasn't fresh, it was hard,  i had to ask them to warm it up to get it manageable. Briskett Burrito was very good. Cute place though, just need to teach your employees how to make coffee the right way.
I would go here everyday if I could. I have never eaten anything that I didn't love here. Their wine tastings are so fun and they are generous with their food pairings.
Very cozy and a great brunch place for the girls <3
A little pricey but delicious and adorable. The parking is rough. I wish they used reusable cups for one store consumption. I'm a lover of the Earth.
Always loved everyday market. So cozy and perfect.
The caramel latte was DELICIOUS & the service is exceptional! They go above & beyond there and provide a warm and inviting atmosphere!
Amazing food, the bread is giving
The breakfast burrito is SO good, definitely one of the best I've had in Charlotte
Amazing place for coffee, breakfast/lunch
Awesome place. Great coffee, good food options , prompt & attentive service. We had a bread pudding, French toast and a grilled chicken wrap. All were yum. Will be back for sure

Great experience here. We ordered a custom Swedish Princess Cake for the holidays and EM came through. The cake was delicious and ordering/communication was easy.

We'll definitely be back to try their other pasties and sandwiches (Porchetta jumps out in particular).

Thanks for the great cake and services.

I have been coming a couple of times and they are always welcoming and nice. The employees are friendly and kind. They have a  delightful selection of pastries and desserts that are delicious!! Their coffee lattes and cappuccinos are very good!! The apricot rugelach is my favorite. There's also a variety of wines. I highly recommend this place!!

A Hidden Gem of Community and Culinary Delight

Everyday Market isn't just a market or convenience store - it's a community haven that consistently goes above and beyond. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted by the warm presence of the owner, who is always hands-on, ensuring every detail is perfect. His personal touch and genuine passion for creating an exceptional experience are immediately apparent.

The resident events are nothing short of spectacular, and I recently attended an absolutely phenomenal wine and cheese gathering that was truly memorable. The carefully curated selection of wines paired perfectly with an impressive array of artisanal cheeses, creating an evening of pure gastronomic pleasure. But this isn't a one-time wonder - their monthly wine tastings are consistently out of this world. Each event feels like a carefully crafted experience that goes far beyond your typical wine tastings.

What sets Everyday Market apart is the genuine sense of community and attention to detail. The owner doesn't just run a business; he creates a welcoming space where residents and customers feel valued and connected. His friendly demeanor and commitment to doing things right shine through in every aspect of the market.

Whether you're a local resident or just passing through, Everyday Market is more than just a shopping destination - it's a delightful experience that will keep you coming back time and time again. Highly recommended!
I had an absolutely lovely experience at this cafe. I tried a few of their treats and drinks, which were all incredible!

What a cute place! It was my first time here, and it was soooo adorable. The baristas were so polite. I had the egg and cheese croissant and I was so shocked they actually scrambled the eggs. The shop is adorable and has a great wine selection as well as great homemade pastries. They also make sourdough in house! Everyday Market is a MUST. I will return!

So glad they opened a location in LoSo. Delicious food and coffee. The avocado toast is fresh and well-made. The coffee is high quality, and they have seasonal flavors. The employees are super kind! A great place to support! We can't wait to come back to get more of their sourdough bread and baked goods for the holidays!
One of the best chai lattes in the city. Delicious pastries and food options. Service is excellent and everyone is so kind.

The inside looks great. I love the atmosphere in the inside and also outside looks so spacious. If it wasn't chilly outside, I could have sat outside and ate. It is a bit pricing my order altogether was $30. And it wasn't a tip I have cheesecake, latte, and a mushroom toast. They did mention that everything is going to be fresh so I guess it does make sense but at the same time it doesn't. But that's just me

The guy did mess up my drink the first time when I asked for whip cream he put too much and spilled all over the cup. He thought that doubling the cup will help, but I do not want my drink spilling out my cup so I ask him to redo it again. The drink was pretty good. I should have asked him to put extra pumpkin syrup on it. I love my drinks very sweet. So 8 out of 10. Out of my latte.

My pumpkin cheesecake was delicious I ate that up like it was the last thing on earth. It was 10 out of 10

And the mushroom toast is...excellent! Nothing was over cooked or undercooked they put some sauce on top of the eggs and mushroom that hit the spot really well.

Overall, The place look really great I would recommend to come over here whenever you're in the area wherever you want breakfast, lunch, brunch, or get your wine sipping on. And I would definitely come back over here whatever I'm in the area. So this is definitely worth $30 and Moore if you want things fresh and ready.

Having spent a significant amount of time in Europe over the past few years, I can honestly say this place is a true delight. It reminded me of a charming cafe in Italy, and I'll definitely be coming back frequently. The porchetta sandwich was absolutely delicious.

What a fantastic experience! Y'all knocked it out of the park!
What a hidden gem
Cute little cafe! Good food

Love this little LoSo neighborhood market whether it's for breakfast & coffee or to share a flatbread and bottle of wine with my fiance or a friend. I'll indulge in the glorious deserts from time to time as well. The owner has such welcoming hospitality and has an amazing hand picked wine selection! You won't be disappointed.
Great place!

Service was excellent, food is delicious!

I didn't catch their name but the barista was very friendly and helped me pick my sandwich. I got a breakfast croissant sandwich, it's flaky, buttery, and full of flavor.

$19 for a large coffee and the croissant. I think the coffee was only $5ish dollars, so maybe a little pricey for the croissant but I think worth it. Probably couldn't be my daily thing at that price tho.

They also have some interesting choices in the shop area of ciders, sake and beer, a few I hadn't seen before. Again some of the choices were on the pricey side but for the quality it seems like good value.
The desserts are amazing (esp the cheesecake), and there's not a bad bottle of wine on the shelf!
First off my sandwich on the house made focaccia was the best I've ever had!! Also the staff was so nice!!
I've finally discovered my favorite spot in town: fantastic food, a wonderful atmosphere, and incredibly friendly people.

We had a great time enjoying delicious sandwiches, salad, pizza, and fresh smoothies at the restaurant. Everything felt really healthy. The staff was super friendly. The chef is very knowledgeable and he even gave us tips on Italian products like olive oil. We're hoping they'll open another spot in South Charlotte. By the way, we're already planning our next visit :)

So glad this place exists! All day amazing breakfasts and so much more. Fantastic and interesting assortment of wine. Nice specialty ingredients. Gorgeous desserts and wonderful, friendly service! What more could anyone want?
Quality! Quality! Quality!  Best coffee shop in Charlotte.

Everyday Market is a wonderful addition to this growing neighborhood. The staff has always been welcoming and knowledgeable. All food items we have tried have been wonderful. Thwy have a great wine bottle selection to boot!

The best pastry and sandwich shop as  well as wine shop I have ever tried !
Staff are so helpful and attentive! Prices are so reasonable and I love the atmosphere,
You have to come for wine tasting on Wednesday to taste the best f
ood and wine ever !!!
I stopped going to their Belmont location because the staff there were not too nice a few times. Glad their LoSo location have good staff / service and I can start going again.
Friendly staff, great coffee, and elite food!
Best strawberry cheesecake I've ever had focaccia bread is fire also  fresh ingredients great service 10/10 recommend

Coming from a person that judges pastries pretty hard, this place is a hidden gem. 

Stumbled on this place by chance and its definitely gonna be added to the rotation
The staff was super welcoming and friendly. The place was very clean and nice looking.

The open window to the kitchen is always welcomed. 

Not like other pastry places, the COFFEE actually tastes good and would definitely recommend 

Give this place a try if you are in the area
We've been in 4 times and have tried several of the sandwiches.  The spicy turkey, roast beef, caprese are all excellent.  We've also brought home a sourdough loaf which was baked perfectly.

One word: Wow! We stumbled in to the market after eating dinner next-door. We met the owner who was incredibly kind and shared his story. We decided on some desserts to try over the next couple of days (chocolate ganache, bourbon brownie, marble brownie, chocolate chip cookies) and even tried some of their breakfast croissants  (chocolate and almond) and blueberry muffin. They were all INCREDIBLE!!! Hands down the best baked goods we have had in Charlotte. We will most definitely be back to try the breakfast sandwiches and lunch sandwiches
Don't usually leave reviews but this place deserves one, amazing food, amazing service, extremely pleasant staff, and they care about their food and customers.

Just opened! In May..
A treasure of cafe items!
The best espresso!!! Hands down.
Great Americana coffee!
The cakes are delicious and fresh!
Going to try the sandwiches next
Our server Joel'  was the best!
Everyone is friendly...

Needed a birthday cake last minute and this place came through with a delicious carrot cake!!!! I wish I saved a picture but the cake was quickly gone. Absolutely amazing desserts! So glad this market has joined the LoSo neighborhood
The breakfast and coffee here is amazing. Then add the decadent pastries. Yum.
This place is amazing. Their desserts are so good, especially the cheesecakes. Also the egg and cheese croissant is to die for.
This place honestly has some of the best pastries I've ever had. So happy it's next to my apartment!

I stopped by The Everyday Market, a new gem in Lower Southend, after seeing it listed on the Goodie Bag app. This locally owned spot, which also has a location in Belmont, is conveniently nestled next to Phat Burrito and Yama LoSo. Despite its recent opening, I was impressed by the steady stream of customers. It's worth noting that parking can be tricky; there's complementary valet and a nearby paid parking garage if you can't snag some free street parking.

Upon entering The Everyday Market, I was welcomed by a coffeehouse/wine bar ambiance, complete with soothing music. The cold beverage cooler caught my eye with an array of drinks, ranging from Mexican Cokes to my favorite Italian iced tea, San Benedetto. Further along, an array of freshly baked pastries tempted the palate, from pound cakes and macarons to cheesecakes and freshly made sandwiches. The next case showcased their freshly baked breads--focaccia, sourdough, and brioche--as well as muffins, croissants, and rugelach. They also offer soup and an impressive selection of wines, many available by the bottle. For the coffee enthusiasts, there's a range of options from cold brew to frappes, smoothies, lattes, and expertly crafted espressos.

The staff, especially Joel, were exceptionally friendly. His welcoming smile and engaging banter brightened my visit. I also appreciated the dog-friendly policy, as well-behaved dogs accompanied their owners inside. If you're into wine tastings, they host them monthly at this location.

For my meal, I opted for the refreshing open-faced salmon toast. The combination of smoked salmon, cream cheese, cucumber slices, hard-boiled egg, arugula, and thinly sliced lemon, drizzled with a light balsamic glaze on sourdough, was delightfully refreshing--perfect for the upcoming summer. Interestingly, the bread wasn't toasted, which suited my preference for softer bread. I also enjoyed a mocha frappe, a perfect antidote to the heat and a great caffeine boost. The "small" size rivals a "Grande" at larger coffee chains, yet isn't overwhelmingly sweet.

My only suggestion for The Everyday Market is to add umbrellas for shade on the outdoor patio. That would make it my go-to spot for enjoying pleasant weekend weather on their patio with a made-to-order sandwich, a San Benedetto iced tea, and perhaps a freshly baked pastry. Here's to many more visits to The Everyday Market! Cheers!
My new favorite spot in Loso!!! Amazing coffee and breakfast sandwiches. The staff is as sweet as can be.
Love it, reminds me of the bakeries in Germany.

We stopped in for coffee last week and ended up getting a few pastries because they looked way too good to pass up. The chocolate chip cookie was great and the Chocolate croissant was unbelievable. Both had a vanilla latte. Mine was hot and my wife's was iced. Both were great! We will def be regulars.
Delicious food and great service! The caprese focaccia is amazing
We stopped in here on our morning walk. Great, friendly service, cute inside, very good pastries and coffee. The chocolate croissant was gone before I  could take a picture! We will be back :)
Best bakery in-town! I use to drive to Belmont all the time. So happy they opened up in Charlotte.
The food is fresh, the staff is welcoming and personable.  Everything about this place is amazing. All you have to do is step inside and you'll be hooked!
Best almond croissant and coffee around. Staff are so friendly.
Came in after work today and got 2 sandwiches. Everything is so fresh and delicious. A much needed spot for this part of town. Can't wait to go back!
Friendly staff, amazing coffee and pastries!
Very friendly staff, tasty pastries and great looking new location!
